snippet: Jeffrey Babbitt, 62, of Brooklyn, died on Monday after a random possible hate crime; he was remembered for his gentle nature and love of comic books.
abstract: Jeffrey Babbitt, Brooklyn man who died after a random possible hate crime, is remembered by friends for his gentle nature and love of comic books; Babbitt was  walking through Union Square when he was punched in the face by an assailant who police say declared his intention to 'punch the first white man I see.'

byline.original: By MICHAEL SCHWIRTZ and NATE SCHWEBER
byline.contributor: Jack Begg and J. David Goodman contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: Jeffrey Babbitt, 62, of Brooklyn, died on Monday after a random possible hate crime; he was remembered for his gentle nature and love of comic books.

headline.main: Friends Mourn Man Fatally Assaulted in Possible Random Hate Crime
headline.print_headline: Friends Mourn Man Fatally Assaulted in Possible Random Hate Crime
